body:
The Tiny Room

Summary: Reader suspects that Chris has been up to something and wants to find out.

Pairing: Chris Evans x Reader

(A/n): I’m sorry if this was bad, I’m trying my best over here:)

~☁︎~

After a year and a half of dating, you and Chris decided that it was time to move in together. You guys barely stayed at your own homes anyway;you were always together. Unless he was filming a movie. One day, Chris brought up the idea of buying a house together. So you guys did.

The hunt for the perfect house took a while. Since you two were mostly in LA, you guys decided on buying the house in LA. (Although, Chris wanted a home in Boston as well, but you two figured out that situation somewhere down the road). You guys found a beautiful house hidden in the quiet and private parts of LA. Everything about it was perfect, it had plenty of space for your dog and Dodger, a nice finished basement for a home gym, and a ton of other things. But, there was this one tiny room, with a tiny door, that you didn’t know what to do with. It was just there. Until one day when Chris secretly decided he was going to do something about it.

~

“I gotta head out real quick, I’ll be back.” Chris said as he kissed your forehead. Before you can reply he was already out the door. You watched from the window as he backed out the driveway and left.

Lately, Chris has been leaving the house more often and he hasn’t been telling you where. Which was a bit odd because when he comes back home from a long shoot, he’d be in bed for a good few weeks and never leave. Not only that, you thought he’d be a bit more upset over the Avengers coming to an end.

You trusted Chris with your life, and you knew he wouldn’t go out and cheat on you. But your stupid imagination wouldn’t stop putting these scenarios in your head and making you think of the worse things that could happen.

You sat on the couch while Dodger laid his head on your lap. Your dog, Marley, was nuzzled in your right side.

“What could daddy be doing?” You asked the two. Dodger let out a huff. You decided that you were going to ask Chris what was going on when he gets back.

You felt someone tapping your side. You stretched out your limbs as they’ve been in the same position for a while. The person began to stroke your back.

“Hey sleepyhead.” You opened your eyes and saw Chris in front of you. You groaned and stuffed your face into the pillow.

“How long have I’ve been asleep?” You asked. You didn’t remember passing out on the couch. Chris chuckled and sat next to your hip.

“I got back and you were already passed out.” He answered, still rubbing your back. You glanced out the window and saw that it was night already. His hands moved soothingly making you drift off again.

“Nuh uh. Come on, get up.” He turned your body over so that your back was to the couch.

“Why?” You whined as he moved the hair out of your face. You rubbed the sleep out your eyes.

“I’ve got a surprise for you, babe. I worked really hard on it.” Chris sat you up and pressed a kiss to your lips. You moaned in satisfaction and wrapped your arms around his neck. He chuckled, pulling away and lifted you off the couch.

“Come on, let’s head up.” He excitedly led you up the stairs. You twirled your hair onto one side and stopped.

“Wh- What did you do?” You questioned him. The dogs were no where to be seen and it was awful quiet.

“You’ll see, now go.” He led you around the halls of your house and stopped at the tiny room. A room that neither you or Chris ever used. It just came with the house. You eyed the door then Chris.

“Open it.” He encouraged. You crouched down and twisted the knob. When you opened the door, you saw fairy lights strung to the top of the room. A small mattress covered in decorative pillows and fuzzy blankets was at the end of the room. There was a small table with a fake plant on it near the entrance of the room. Around the small corner, you saw your dogs pop their heads out.

“Chris. This is- wow. How did you even get all of this through the door?” You gasped. Chris let out a laugh and crawled into the room after you. When you got to the end of the room, there was a small space. The dogs were snuggled on a giant dog bed with little toys and plushies on it.

“I decided to make this some kind of comfort room. Ya know? Like when you need a break and you just need to take a step back from the world. It’s also a room for the dogs.” He explained as he put his arm around you. You were laying down on the small mattress he placed in the room.

“So you like it?” He asked.

“Oh my god I love it. Who knew you had some sense of style in you.” You joked. The decor inside matched the whole vibe of the room. Suddenly you remember the question you were to ask him earlier.

“Wait. So you aren’t cheating on me?” You asked innocently. Chris’s head snapped at you.

“Why in the world would I cheat on you?” He asked as he moved to look at you.

“You’ve been secretive and you kept leaving the house! I couldn’t help but think of the negative things that could’ve been happening!” You defended. Chris sighed as a lop sided grin made its way on his face.

“I’m sorry I made you think that. But to clarify I’m not cheating and I will never do it. I love you too much to even do something like that.” He said as he stroked your cheek. You grabbed his hand that was on your cheek and held it.

“Good, because you’re not getting rid of me that easily.” You quipped. His eyes twinkled as he leaned in.

“I’m not planning to.” His lips crashed onto yours. He lowered you down on the puffy pillows as you kissed him back.

That night, you guys spent the time in each other’s arms, in the newly named “comfort room”, according to Chris. The dogs came in and out of the room checking in on you guys. You two spent time discussing your futures and the new things that were happening in your life. From that day on the comfort room became a sacred place to you and Chris. It was a place for you to let your feelings out and have deep talks with each other. The dogs also enjoyed having a room of their own.

blog.title: My Guilty Pleasure
blog.description: Just a place for all things related to my crush on all the Marvel Men, but ESPECIALLY Chris Evans, with a heavy dose of Tom Hiddleston.  My writings are at avengernerdmom.wordpress.com

caption:
Exposed

Being Thalia

Chapter 12

By avenger-nerd-mom & devikafernando

AU Fan Fiction

In the sequel to Educating Thalia, the lovely Thalia Bareo is growing up, making her own way in the world after losing both men she loved, Professors Chris Evans and Tom Hiddleston. The sassy full-figured Puerto Rican girl from Chicago holds down a job as she tries to deal with the real world. She continues her studies and freelances as a consultant for museums around the world. Being Thalia updates are posted on Wednesdays and Sundays.

Warning: As a whole, this work contains adult content. If you proceed you have agreed that you are willing to see such content. Each chapter will not be coded with individual warnings. The overall story contains no hidden triggers.

If you are new to the series and characters, click here to the beginning of Educating Thalia.

If you are looking for other stories in the sequel, click here for the beginning of Being Thalia

Word Count 1774

Summary: Feeling stripped down, Thalia finally reaches out for help.

Previous Chapter, Peace Offering

July 2021

“I’m pretty sure at that point, I blacked out. Seriously, I don’t even remember going back to my room.” Thalia presses her palm against the window, looking out over the city.  “The mini-bar was empty the next morning, booze and chocolate, and I didn’t attend any of the other sessions I was supposed to proctor for the museum. Thank God my flight was for Monday morning.”

“Did you see him again?” the calming voice asks.

Thalia turns on her heels. She shrugs, looking down at her boots. Her blasted boots she’s never been able to get rid of because of all the memories attached to them. She’s had them resoled twice to make them last. Declining to share that with the therapist, she says, “I was across the street at the pharmacy when I watched him pull away in an Uber. I bought another bottle of wine and a box of donuts.” She pats her thighs. “There was still some wine left the next morning… And if you ever try to turn one of these sessions around, to discuss my eating habits, I’m out the door.”

“Fair enough,” the older woman says. “You seem healthy, despite being a big girl.” She tilts her head to the side, doodling in the margins on her paper. “Do you exercise?”

Thalia walks to the bookshelves. She always believed one could tell a lot about a person by the books on their shelves. Tom’s book is rested on a side table and she runs her hand over the shiny cover. She doesn’t indicate the man in question is him.

To distract herself, she pulls an old leather bound volume from the shelf. “Lovely copy,” she states, tenderly caressing the crepey thin pages. “I try to get in about fifteen thousand steps a day. I lift weights, and eat healthy.” She slowly bounces her head up and down. “The man I was living with before I moved here to Madrid, he was a bit of a fitness buff. I may not look like it, but I take care of myself. I’m actually down in weight a bit, my clothes fit better since moving here. I can’t decide if it’s depression or just becoming a true Madrileña… Six smaller meals a day seems to work for me.” She places the book back on the shelf. “My apartment is close to the MAN and I’m able to walk most of the places I need to go.”

The therapist watches as Thalia continues to saunter around the room. “Where do you like to go? Have you made friends here?”

Seriously, I don’t even remember going back to my room.” Thalia presses her palm against the window, looking out over the city.  “The mini-bar was empty the next morning, booze and chocolate, and I didn’t attend any of the other sessions I was supposed to proctor for the museum. Thank God my flight was for Monday morning.”

“Did you see him again?” the calming voice asks.

Thalia turns on her heels. She shrugs, looking down at her boots. Her blasted boots she’s never been able to get rid of because of all the memories attached to them. She’s had them resoled twice to make them last. Declining to share that with the therapist, she says, “I was across the street at the pharmacy when I watched him pull away in an Uber. I bought another bottle of wine and a box of donuts.” She pats her thighs. “There was still some wine left the next morning… And if you ever try to turn one of these sessions around, to discuss my eating habits, I’m out the door.”

“Fair enough,” the older woman says. “You seem healthy, despite being a big girl.” She tilts her head to the side, doodling in the margins on her paper. “Do you exercise?”

Thalia walks to the bookshelves. She always believed one could tell a lot about a person by the books on their shelves. Tom’s book is rested on a side table and she runs her hand over the shiny cover. She doesn’t indicate the man in question is him.

To distract herself, she pulls an old leather bound volume from the shelf. “Lovely copy,” she states, tenderly caressing the crepey thin pages. “I try to get in about fifteen thousand steps a day. I lift weights, and eat healthy.” She slowly bounces her head up and down. “The man I was living with before I moved here to Madrid, he was a bit of a fitness buff. I may not look like it, but I take care of myself. I’m actually down in weight a bit, my clothes fit better since moving here. I can’t decide if it’s depression or just becoming a true Madrileña… Six smaller meals a day seems to work for me.” She places the book back on the shelf. “My apartment is close to the MAN and I’m able to walk most of the places I need to go.”

The therapist watches as Thalia continues to saunter around the room. “Where do you like to go? Have you made friends here?”

body:
Chris Evans Drabble 1

A/N: So the person who requested this wanted to remain anonymous. Anyways, here it is. I wasn’t able to make it 1k idk why, but I just couldn’t. I hope you still like it.


The media was outraged. Everything was wild, and it was safe to say that shit was going to hit the fan. Or more so, it had already had. The news media was going crazy after the events that had escalated last night, and you didn’t know what to do. Basically everyone on social media shammed you for your actions. Forgetting that it takes two to tango and you weren’t completely at fault. But you could understand why some people who blame everything on you, nobody likes to put their favourite celebrities in a bad situation. Also the situation looked bad on your part, just in general. An up and coming singer, has a small fan base. Sleeps with another even more famous…yeah it does look bad.

You’d never picture yourself as someone who’d be with a guy who’s engaged. Not in a million years. The whole thing kinda just happened. Sure it was wrong, but that’s how things went. Neither the less, people wanted a bunch of interviews with you, wanting to know why on earth you’d ruin someone else’s life. You didn’t want to take any of those interviews. But your team told you that it would probably be best to take them. Otherwise, people would just take whatever they hear. So it’s worth a shot.

Chris has tried to talk to you several times after everything exploded. You also wanted to talk to him, but your agent told you not to. Your agent had a lot of hope for you. So she didn’t want your reputation to be ruined. So you tried your best to listen to her.

It was currently Tuesday night and you were in the studio. Trying to rewrite one of the songs that was supposed to go onto your newest album. You didn’t like the hook so you wanted to rewrite it. There was no flow of inspiration in you, you were bored. You wanted to just go and see Chris, but you were being watched like a ducking hawk. You couldn’t take it. This wasn’t how you wanted your life to be like. Yet this is what is currently was. You decided to give up and turn on the tv, maybe there was something to watch? Eh, it really didn’t matter. You just needed to take something off of your mind. Yet when you turned on the tv, it just made you even more stressed.

“I couldn’t imagine being in that situation.” The talk show host stated. His ex was on national tv crying a whole ass fucking river. Chris complained about her a lot. They were forced to date each other for movie press, but after the movie press was over she honestly thought he liked her. He wanted to break it off with her, but his team told him not too.

“Yes, I just couldn’t imagine in a million years something like this happening. If only Chris haven’t fell for that…that bitch.” You rolled your eyes, and turned off the tv. You couldn’t handle it. You were on the verge of breaking down, but you tried to keep your shit together.

Ron, the man who was watching you was wondering were you were going. You told him you needed to head over to the drugstore. He asked to come with you but you told him no. He was suspicious but let you go.

You weren’t headed to the drugstore (obviously), you were heading over to Chris’s house. Which was a stupid idea.

After you left the studio a verge of paparazzi were standing outside. Asking all of the questions everyone is dying to know. You almost didn’t make it to the car. Then once you finally did make it. You couldn’t even fucking start it because everyone was crowding around it, and if you tried to move the car. You’d just hit someone, and you’re not trying to start a whole other situation. You ended up sitting in your car for 16 minutes before you were able to leave.

Now you were heading over to Chris’s house sweaty, tired and annoyed. It’s safe to say that you weren’t doing well.

You rushed over and tried to knock on the door. You didn’t want to draw as much attention as you just did. So you were hoping he’d hurry up and answer the door. Except he didn’t.

His ex did.

Neither the less, people wanted a bunch of interviews with you, wanting to know why on earth you’d ruin someone else’s life. You didn’t want to take any of those interviews. But your team told you that it would probably be best to take them. Otherwise, people would just take whatever they hear. So it’s worth a shot.

Chris has tried to talk to you several times after everything exploded. You also wanted to talk to him, but your agent told you not to. Your agent had a lot of hope for you. So she didn’t want your reputation to be ruined. So you tried your best to listen to her.

It was currently Tuesday night and you were in the studio. Trying to rewrite one of the songs that was supposed to go onto your newest album. You didn’t like the hook so you wanted to rewrite it. There was no flow of inspiration in you, you were bored. You wanted to just go and see Chris, but you were being watched like a ducking hawk. You couldn’t take it. This wasn’t how you wanted your life to be like. Yet this is what is currently was. You decided to give up and turn on the tv, maybe there was something to watch? Eh, it really didn’t matter. You just needed to take something off of your mind. Yet when you turned on the tv, it just made you even more stressed.

“I couldn’t imagine being in that situation.” The talk show host stated. His ex was on national tv crying a whole ass fucking river. Chris complained about her a lot. They were forced to date each other for movie press, but after the movie press was over she honestly thought he liked her. He wanted to break it off with her, but his team told him not too.

“Yes, I just couldn’t imagine in a million years something like this happening. If only Chris haven’t fell for that…that bitch.” You rolled your eyes, and turned off the tv. You couldn’t handle it. You were on the verge of breaking down, but you tried to keep your shit together.

Ron, the man who was watching you was wondering were you were going. You told him you needed to head over to the drugstore. He asked to come with you but you told him no. He was suspicious but let you go.

You weren’t headed to the drugstore (obviously), you were heading over to Chris’s house. Which was a stupid idea.

After you left the studio a verge of paparazzi were standing outside. Asking all of the questions everyone is dying to know. You almost didn’t make it to the car. Then once you finally did make it. You couldn’t even fucking start it because everyone was crowding around it, and if you tried to move the car. You’d just hit someone, and you’re not trying to start a whole other situation. You ended up sitting in your car for 16 minutes before you were able to leave.

Now you were heading over to Chris’s house sweaty, tired and annoyed. It’s safe to say that you weren’t doing well.

You rushed over and tried to knock on the door. You didn’t want to draw as much attention as you just did. So you were hoping he’d hurry up and answer the door. Except he didn’t.

His ex did.
